title: Best Investment Strategies to Generate Passive Income
summary: Passive income is earning money through investments that require little to no effort on your part. This can include money earned from royalties, interest, dividends, and more. If youâ€™re not a workaholic, this is probably your best option for generating consistent income. Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) is a type of passive investment that pools capital from investors to purchase real estate assets. Hedge funds are high-risk investments that come with high fees, but also promise high returns.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thinking of investing to accumulate wealth and generate passive income? Passive income is a broad term that encompasses any income you receive from an investment, venture, or business that requires little maintenance. Passive income is the Holy Grail for personal finance, because it allows you to make money while not actively working. It\u2019s the ultimate goal for most investors.
Researchers suggest that passive income will be the primary source of retirement funding for millennials. However, this financial strategy isn\u2019t easy for everyone, especially with so many different ways to invest your money and get a return on your investment. If you\u2019re considering starting your own business or launching a side hustle to generate passive income streams, here are some trusted strategies that may suit your risk profile and goals.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Basics of Passive Income"),mdx("p",null,`The basic definition of passive income is earning money through investments (stocks, bonds, real estate) that require little to no effort on your part. This can include money earned from royalties, interest, dividends, and more.
If you\u2019re not a workaholic, this is probably your best option for generating consistent income. While you might have to put some capital upfront, you don\u2019t have to keep working at that money once you\u2019ve put in the work upfront.`),mdx("p",null,"There are two primary types of passive income:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Residual income: This is money that you earn on top of what you\u2019re already making. Residual income could come from co-owning a website that gets paid per click or writing a book and earning royalties from each sale."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Current income: This is money that you earn while actively engaged in the work needed to make that money. Current income includes things like renting a spare room on Airbnb and driving for Uber.")),mdx("h2",null,"Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT)"),mdx("p",null,"A real estate investment trust, or REIT, is a type of passive investment that pools capital from investors to purchase real estate assets. REITs are managed by a team of professional real estate investors. They pick specific properties based on the cash flow expected from those properties. REITs typically have high initial liquidity and low management fees, making them an attractive option for investors looking to generate rental cash flow and earn passive income, though it\u2019s important to do your research before investing in any REIT."),mdx("p",null,"REITs are governed by the Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) Act of 1986. This act requires that 95% of the trust\u2019s income be distributed as dividends to shareholders at least once per year. The majority of REITs operate as publicly traded entities and can be purchased through an investment broker."),mdx("p",null,"REITs are a relatively safe investment, but there are a few things to keep in mind before diving in. First, the yield you receive on your investment will depend on the performance of the underlying real estate. Second, REITs are highly sensitive to rising interest rates. When interest rates rise, the value of all types of real estate falls. Third, REITs are highly illiquid. This means you\u2019ll have to wait until the trust\u2019s term ends before you can sell your investment and cash out."),mdx("h2",null,"Equity Investment"),mdx("p",null,"An equity investment is the purchase of a portion of a company\u2019s stock. Equity investments are long-term investments that can be very lucrative, but also come with a significant amount of risk. There are several different types of equity investments, including:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Pre-IPO: This is an equity investment in a company that is currently pre-revenue. This is a very high-risk type of investment, since most pre-IPO companies won\u2019t generate any revenue for years, if at all.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Seed and early-stage equity: This is an equity investment in a company that is in the early stages of revenue generation. While this type of investment is riskier than a standard equity investment, it also carries a lower expected return.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Growth equity and late-stage equity: This is an equity investment in a company that has already established itself as a profitable business. This is the safest type of equity investment, since it carries the highest expected return."))),mdx("h2",null,"Hedge Fund Investment"),mdx("p",null,"Hedge funds are privately managed investment funds that invest in a wide variety of financial instruments, like stocks, bonds, commodities, and real estate. Hedge funds are high-risk investments that come with high fees, but also promise high returns. Hedge fund investment strategies can vary widely, but most hedge funds are actively managed by a team of investment experts. It\u2019s important to note that hedge funds aren\u2019t regulated like other investment funds, so investors don\u2019t have the same protections or fiduciary responsibilities that they would with other funds."),mdx("p",null,"Before investing in a hedge fund, it\u2019s important to make sure the fund is registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). It\u2019s also a good idea to examine the fund\u2019s historical performance and make sure it\u2019s properly diversified. Hedge funds are illiquid investments, so you likely can\u2019t get your money out anytime soon."),mdx("h2",null,"Virtual Company"),mdx("p",null,"A virtual company is a business that\u2019s run entirely online. This can include everything from blogging and website building to content marketing. Some popular business ideas for virtual companies are tutoring and freelance writing. Before investing in a virtual company, it\u2019s important to research the industry and make sure it\u2019s profitable. You may also want to consider hiring a freelance researcher to look into a few of the top companies in the industry to see how they operate and how much they pay freelancers."),mdx("p",null,"When researching potential virtual companies to invest in, it\u2019s important to make sure you\u2019re investing in a legitimate business. There are several ways to research a business to see if it\u2019s legitimate, but one of the easiest ways is to visit the Better Business Bureau website and search for the company in question."),mdx("h2",null,"Bond Investment Strategies"),mdx("p",null,"Bonds are debt instruments issued by governments, companies, and municipalities. They\u2019re generally low-risk investments, but they don\u2019t offer the same high returns that stocks do. A bond is essentially an IOU: when you buy a bond, you\u2019re lending money to the issuer. In return, you earn a fixed interest rate until the bond matures. There are several types of bonds, including government, corporate, municipal, and high-yield bonds."),mdx("p",null,"Government bonds are backed by the full faith and credit of the issuing government. Corporate bonds are backed by the assets of the issuing company. Municipal bonds are backed by the issuing municipality. High-yield bonds have lower credit ratings, which means they carry a higher rate of return to compensate for the increased risk."),mdx("h2",null,"Summing Up"),mdx("p",null,"Investing is one of the best ways to make money and build your wealth, but it doesn\u2019t work for everyone. Think about your risk tolerance, goals, and personality type before diving into any investment strategy."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re not a workaholic, this is probably your best option for generating consistent income. While you might have to put some capital upfront, you don\u2019t have to keep working at that money once you\u2019ve put in the work upfront."),mdx("p",null,"These are some of the top investment strategies that can help you generate passive income. Real estate, equity investments, hedge funds, and virtual companies are all high-risk, but potentially high-reward, ways to make money."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Money Work for You - Investing 101

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"People have many different reasons for saving money. Some are very frugal and use every spare penny to pay down debt, buy a home, or fund retirement plans. However, many people simply stash away their cash in a bank account hoping it will grow over time. While this is the tried-and-true method of savings, it won\u2019t help you get rich. To grow your wealth instead of simply preserving it, you need to invest your cash and work on growing that money over time. Even if you\u2019re young and have an extended road toward retirement ahead of you, there are still smart investing strategies that can help you build wealth sooner rather than later. Investing isn\u2019t complicated; even with its fancy words like \u201Casset allocation\u201D and \u201Cbeta coefficient.\u201D Here are some helpful investing tips to get started..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are No-Load Mutual Funds and Are They Right for You?
Why You Should Start Investing Now

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As a millennial, you may feel like your future is bleak because of student loan debt, limited job prospects and stagnant wages. But the reality is that your financial future can be bright if you take action now. Investing as early as possible is perhaps the most effective way to grow your wealth over time.
Investing even a small amount of money now can have a big impact on your long-term financial success. Time is your greatest ally when it comes to growing your money \u2014 the earlier you begin investing, the greater potential return you will see later in life. At Intrinzik we believe that everyone should learn about personal finance and invest responsibly for their future. With this article we want to give you some insights about why you should start investing now and what are the best ways to do it:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Top Investing Blogs to Follow in 2019
Why You Should Invest in Index Funds

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The stock market can be frightening. It is easy to get caught up in the moment and panic when it drops, or get overly excited when it rises. But if you take a step back and look at investing from a long-term perspective, things are not as scary. In fact, index funds are a great way to invest your money for the long run.
It is natural to have some fear or apprehension about putting your hard-earned money at risk by investing in the stock market. After all, many people witnessed the bursting of the dotcom bubble first hand and saw their retirement accounts plummet as a result. However, that does not mean you should avoid investing in stocks altogether\u2014not even with recent recession still fresh on everyone\u2019s mind.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Investing for Retirement

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The quality of life for most people in their golden years is directly correlated to how well they prepared for retirement. According to a recent report by the National Institute on Retirement Security, as many as one-third of Americans are at risk of being unable to maintain their current standard of living in retirement. That\u2019s because many are not putting away enough money on a regular basis.
An investment strategy that can be useful for helping you achieve your retirement goals is known as "retirement investing." This type of investing is geared toward enabling you to retire sooner with a more comfortable and secure standard of living. If you\u2019re not quite ready to retire but would like to have more financial security once you do, it\u2019s probably time to begin planning for your post-work life. A good place to start is by familiarizing yourself with the many different types of retirement investing available. Understanding these various options along with their pros and cons will help you determine which one(s) might be right for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Build a Diversified Investment Portfolio
Getting Started in Real Estate Investing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Real estate investing can be a very lucrative career or side gig. It may seem like a lot of work, but the truth is that it\u2019s not as difficult as you think. You\u2019ll be surprised at how simple real estate investing can be if you know what to do and where to start. If you\u2019re new to the world of real estate investing, then this blog post will help get you started down the right path.
This article will walk you through different types of real estate investments and reveal ways to get started in this market today. Even if you don\u2019t have millions of dollars lying around, there are still plenty of ways for you to get your feet wet in the world of real estate investing without breaking the bank.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Investing for Beginners - Where to Start

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You can either love it or hate it. But investing is something that we all have to deal with at some point in our lives. If you\u2019re someone who likes math, logic, and problem-solving \u2013 and doesn\u2019t shy away from risk \u2013 then maybe investing is for you. For the rest of us, however, the idea of investing can seem a little bit scary. But don\u2019t worry; investing is much simpler than most people think, especially if you have a basic understanding of how personal finance works. Keeping a detailed record of your money isn\u2019t difficult and every person should invest their earnings for the future. Whether you have $5 or $500 to invest as a beginner, there are lots of great places to put that money so that it can grow over time. The trick is knowing which investment options are best for you and your circumstances..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Pick the Right Investments for You
